data.title: Simple Game of Quarters
data.statement:
Alice and Bob are playing multiple rounds of a game of quarters.  The person with the most rounds won is the overall winner!

<<Round Rules>>

A round consists of each trying to predict a sequence of 3 coin flips that will appear before the other player's sequence of 3 coin flips.  They write their sequence prediction in secret.  They then toss a coin 20 times recording either <<H>> for heads and <<T>> for tails.  They then reveal their predictions and determine who won the round.

Example:
Alice predicts <<HTH>>
Bob predicts <<TTH>>
The coin flips: <<HTTHHTHTTHHHTHTHHTHH>>

Bob wins this round since <<TTH>> appears before <<HTH>>

<<Draw Rules>>

If both Alice and Bob picked the same sequence or neither person's sequence appears in the round then it is a draw.

<<Goal>>

Determine the person with the most rounds won!

testCases.title: Single Round Bob Wins
testCases.testIn:
1
HTH TTH HTTHHTHTTHHHTHTHHTHH

data.stubGenerator:
read numberOfRounds:int
loop numberOfRounds read aliceSequence:word(3) bobSequence:word(3) roundTosses:word(20)
write WINNER!
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>>  An integer [[N]] to indicate the number of rounds.
<<[[N]] Lines>>  Alice's 3 sequence prediction followed by a space followed by Bob's 3 sequence prediction followed by a space followed by the recorded 20 tosses of a coin
data.outputDescription:
If Alice wins more rounds than Bob then {{Alice wins!}} should be printed.
If Bob wins more rounds than Alice then {{Bob wins!}} should be printed.
If neither has more wins than each other then {{Draw!}} should be printed.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Alice and Bob are playing multiple rounds of a game of quarters. The person with the most rounds won is the overall winner!

Round Rules

A round consists of each trying to predict a sequence of 3 coin flips that will appear before the other player's sequence of 3 coin flips. They write their sequence prediction in secret. They then toss a coin 20 times recording either H for heads and T for tails. They then reveal their predictions and determine who won the round.

Example:
Alice predicts HTH
Bob predicts TTH
The coin flips: HTTHHTHTTHHHTHTHHTHH

Bob wins this round since TTH appears before HTH

Draw Rules

If both Alice and Bob picked the same sequence or neither person's sequence appears in the round then it is a draw.

Goal

Determine the person with the most rounds won!
Input
Line 1: An integer N to indicate the number of rounds.
N Lines Alice's 3 sequence prediction followed by a space followed by Bob's 3 sequence prediction followed by a space followed by the recorded 20 tosses of a coin
Output
If Alice wins more rounds than Bob then Alice wins! should be printed.
If Bob wins more rounds than Alice then Bob wins! should be printed.
If neither has more wins than each other then Draw! should be printed.
Constraints
1 <= N <= 20
Example
Input
1
HTH TTH HTTHHTHTTHHHTHTHHTHH
Output
Bob wins!
